title: Preparation of the Annual Budget for the Year 2022
decision_details:
- The Minister of Finance informed the Cabinet the following measures intended to be taken when preparing Annual Budget for the year 2022 within the Medium Term Budgetary Framework 2022-2024 and the Cabinet granted its concurrence for the same.

	(a)	Macroeconomic Targets expected to be achieved ( As percentage of 	GDP) -

		*	Government Revenue		-	13.0
		*	Government Expenditure		-	20.6
		*	Budget Deficit			-	-7.5
		*	Central Government Debt		-	95.0
		*	Economic Growth	Rate		-	6.0

	In order to achieve the said targets, it is expected to maintain a stable  exchange rate, to maintain the inflation at a stable figure of 5% and to bring the unemployment rate below 4%, in the year 2022.
	
	(b)	keep the country open while safeguarding public health and continuing 	precautionary measures against the Covid -19 pandemic.

	(c)	Giving top priorities for using digital technology for rendering 	public service, providing required relief and facilities  for the sectors 	affected by the Covid -19, expanding and promoting import substitutes 	encouraging private sector investments towards export-oriented sectors, 	strengthening foreign direct investments by creating friendly 	environment for the investment, expanding government revenue and 	moving towards renewable energy.
	(d)	highly discouraging the activities such as new constructions except 	ongoing projects and tasks, expanding office space, purchase of new 	furniture and equipment, 	new recruitment, purchase of new vehicles 	other than essential	vehicles, until the economy returned to the 	normalcy.

	(e)	moving every Government institution towards new avenues of revenue 	generation in their capacity during  the year 2022.
